title: Country singer Ned Ledoux's 2-year-old daughter dies in choking accident
text:
Ned LeDoux (Photo: submitted)

Country singer Ned LeDoux lost his two-year-old daughter, Haven, in a choking accident Oct. 20, according to a statement from the family.

Paramedics were called to the LeDoux family's home in Northeast Kansas but were unable to resuscitate the little girl.

LeDoux is the son of the late platinum-selling country singer Chris LeDoux.

The statement said the LeDoux family appreciates love and support and requests privacy during this time.

LeDoux most recently released "Sagebrush" in late 2017. His singles include "Brother Highway" and "Some People Do."

The late Chris LeDoux was a rodeo star before he made it as a musical artist. He died in 2005 of cancer at the age of 56. His hits include "This Cowboy's Hat" and "Cadillac Ranch."

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2019/10/28/country-singer-ned-ledoux-daughter-haven-dies-accident/2488850001/
description: Country singer Ned Ledoux's two-year-old daughter, Haven, died in a choking accident at the family home.
